note.p: Death: St Stephen Wallbrook, London (08 February 1725)
Burial: Friends' cemetery at Bunhill Fields
Career: A Quaker philanthropist, he wrote on prison reform, education, and made proposals for a 'College of industry'; friend of William Penn (FRS 1681) and of Sir Hans Sloane (FRS 1685)
References: Geoffrey Cantor, 'Quakers in the Royal Society, 1660-1750' in NR 1997 vol 51 pp 175-193
